Detailed Description

This class provides base level functionality for each controller. This includes the ability to register multiple models and views, propogating model change events to each of the views, and providing a utility function to broadcast model property changes when necessary.

Author:
Robert Eckstein

void ScheatorController.AbstractController.addModel ( AbstractModel  model  ) 

Binds a model to this controller. Once added, the controller will listen for all model property changes and propogate them on to registered views. In addition, it is also responsible for resetting the model properties when a view changes state.

Parameters:
model The model to be added

Definition at line 50 of file AbstractController.java.

void ScheatorController.AbstractController.addView ( AbstractViewPanel  view  ) 

Binds a view to this controller. The controller will propogate all model property changes to each view for consideration.

Parameters:
view The view to be added

void ScheatorController.AbstractController.propertyChange ( PropertyChangeEvent  evt  ) 

This method is used to implement the PropertyChangeListener interface. Any model changes will be sent to this controller through the use of this method.

Parameters:
evt An object that describes the model's property change.

void ScheatorController.AbstractController.setModelProperty ( String  propertyName,
Object  newValue 
) [protected]

Convienence method that subclasses can call upon to fire off property changes back to the models. This method used reflection to inspect each of the model classes to determine if it is the owner of the property in question. If it isn't, a NoSuchMethodException is throws (which the method ignores).

Parameters:
propertyName The name of the property
newValue An object that represents the new value of the property.
